div.div: Size of this PNG preview of this SVG file: 750 × 500 pixels. Other resolutions: 320 × 213 pixels | 640 × 427 pixels | 800 × 533 pixels | 1,024 × 683 pixels | 1,280 × 853 pixels.

div.p: Original file ‎(SVG file, nominally 750 × 500 pixels, file size: 22 KB)

tr.td:
This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons. Information from its description page there is shown below.
Commons is a freely licensed media file repository. You can help.

table.style: border:2px solid #D3D3D3; width:100%; background-color:#F8F8F8; text-align:center; direction:ltr;

tr.td: It is easy to put a border around this flag image:

a.title: fr:Drapeau de la Caroline du Nord

div.a: Drapeau de la Caroline du Nord

div.div: Français cadien: Flag de la Caroline du Nord
日本語: 北卡羅萊那の旗 / ノースカロライナ州の旗
Diné bizaad: Náhookǫsjí Kééláanah Hahoodzo bidah naatʼaʼí
Српски / srpski: Zastava američke savezne države Severne Karoline
div.p: Taken from the xrmap flag collection, version 2.7

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa;

td.div: This image shows a flag, a coat of arms, a seal or some other official insignia. The use of such symbols is restricted in many countries. These restrictions are independent of the copyright status.

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction: ltr; border-spacing: 8px; padding: 0px;

tr.td: This work is in the public domain in the U.S. because it is an edict of a U.S. local or state government. See § 313.6(C)(1) of Compendium of U.S. Copyright Office Practices. Such documents include "judicial opinions, administrative rulings, legislative enactments, public ordinances, and similar official legal documents."

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; text-align:center; margin:0.5em auto; border:1px solid #555555; background:#f6f7f5; direction:ltr;

td.i:
This image from the Xrmap flag collection (source: flags-2.6-src.tar.bz2).
The README file in that collection says of the SVG flags "We release them in the public domain".

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction: ltr; border-spacing: 8px; padding: 0px;

td.i: This work has been released into the public domain by its copyright holder, Xrmap. This applies worldwide.
td.small: In some countries this may not be legally possible; if so:
td.i: Xrmap grants anyone the right to use this work for any purpose, without any conditions, unless such conditions are required by law.

div.p: Click on a date/time to view the file as it appeared at that time.

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 17:24, 22 March 2017
Thumbnail for version as of 16:52, 22 March 2017
Thumbnail for version as of 17:25, 23 February 2013

tr.td: Reverted to version as of 07:52, 20 January 2012

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 14:44, 23 February 2013

tr.td: Changed colors to match U.S. flag, per § 144‑6.

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 07:52, 20 January 2012

tr.td: fix hoist, why that start and the "N" and "C" had black borders is beyond me, fixed banners and wording colours

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 04:50, 23 April 2007
Thumbnail for version as of 04:42, 23 April 2007

tr.td: § 144‑6 States that the red and blue on the NC flag is the same as the US flag

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 07:56, 21 January 2006

tr.td: Let me see if this works...

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 19:33, 16 September 2005
